title: WTF is wrong with riot?
body:
The 90% of the league community ask for lee nerfs they WANT lee nerfs they prove with every possible way that this champion is beyond broken with math/statistic/overload kits/etc

And for some reason riot ignores everyone and when a champion is close to hit 50% win ratio and he is a jungler he gets insta nerf! i am done with this game i am done with riot! for real this is disgusting..this behavior is retarded

probably most of the players on the boards are either bronze or low level players, most of them can never fight a lee sin because they're bad, most of them overextend early game giving lee sin an easy gank

A champion can't be declared OP with simple math, you can't just take ratios and other stuff and declare said champion overpowered, you need to consider the effect said champion has in games, how his power curve develops and how it evolves over the course of the match.

most people just jump into the lee sin nerf sheep like mentality and provide no real math or very biased and flawled math on why lee should be nerfed.

that post was purely about damage, having high damage potential doesn't make a champion overpowered, wu had less damage but he has more teamfighting power, pantheon has less damage but he has more map control and a reliable stun

Warwick used to be my main when i started playing, and unlike you i know the reason behind his nerfing, the smite interactions were uninteded, it was too powerful, botrk + red smite ultimate would almost instantly kill an ADC 

Lee sin is not considered overpowered in all elos, if so, link posts of high level people complaining about lee sin

so you are saying the people on the boards is 90% of the entire league of legends player base
i would say something about this but i will just let you stay in your fantasy world

1) People on the boards make up a small, very vocal minority, and they are usually senselessly raging. 
2) Circlejerk group-think mentality. 
3) People don't know what they're talking about.
4) I doubt Riot can rework a champion on a whim.
5) Forumers can't seem to handle a discussion that doesn't involve images of them flipping riot off.

Despite being told that they don't care about win/loss rates that's not entirely true. Part of the reason why they won't nerf Lee is because he has a terrible win rate.

Edit: Downvoted for stating a fact? Stay Bronze.

50% win ratio would be balanced.

Half on one side - Wins

Half on the other - Losses

The definition of balance.

Getting a 50% winrate exact won't happen but thinking that someone is to strong because they are getting close to the 50% isn't reasonable. 76 of the 123 champions have over a 50% win rate in ranked play.  Over this last month lee has had a 47% winrate coming in 110th place out of the 123 champs when it comes to winrate.
Show me supposed 90% you are pulling out of a hat. I'd like to see actual, credible numbers on that.

90% of community = the retarded, circlejerking low elos that  complain on these boards

yeah. it looks like we got to nerf lee sin!!!!!111111

Lee Sin was going to get a rework but it was met with one of the biggest community backlash in LoL history (not just on these forums or reddit, everywhere). So instead of nerfing his early game and buffing his lategame, they nerfed Safeguard (CD on non-champions, shield duration) and removed his attack speed debuff.

The community wanted Lee Sin to keep his identity as a slippery early game monster that turns into a tanky initiator (Insec kicks) late game.

It's not because a local circle jerk is calling for nerfs that it's the opinion of the majority.
They are too blind to see that yo
